text: Ce liquide doré est légèrement visqueux. De fines bulles montent lentement à la surface. Un beau mélange de pommes; certaines fraîches, certaines cuites en arôme. Des pointes acidulées qui nous picotent les narines. Les saveurs sont sucrée et fruitées au travers une texture soyeuse, qui est perturbée par une effervescence alternative. En fin de bouche, cest acidulé. Le clapet éprouve une certaine difficulté au passage, comme si le liquoreux mêlé aux bulles ne faisaient pas bon ménage. Cest trop épais pour être mousseux. Version à 7% (2112-280217)

A beautiful golden cider with aroma of sweet apple jam, light citrus, nice and smooth. In mouth, a beautiful complex mix of apple jam, cooked apples, candy floss, alcohol warmth, very nice and complex. Mondial des Cidres 2017.
Pours a copper colour. Aroma of baked apple with a bit of spice. The body is really lightened by the carbonation. Taste is of toffee, apple skin, and caramel. Really nice, not too sweet.
Bottle - Very overripe apple with some nice soft cooked Apple notes. Clear gold. Nice sweet light cooked Apple. No bitterness or peel. Very soft and subtle.

Tasting at Matts, corked bottleSkewed Refractometer Reading: 19.4°BBeautiful bright amber color. Deep aroma, stewed apples, chestnuts/hazelnuts, touch of cinnamon. The mouthfeel is gently carbonated, it has a high degree of sweetness, moderate acidity, apple puree.Maybe because of the fermentation, it seems that the flavor fades in the final. But its very good.
375ml bottle at Matts. Pours clear golden. Aroma is sweet, candied apples. Taste is sweet, slightly sour, caramel apples. Very good.

375mL bottle, pours clear caramel colour. Aroma is packed with caramel apples, brown sugar, and baked apple pie. Flavour is intensely sweet, even for an ice cider, with lots of caramel apple dominating, followed by some treacle toffee. High residual sweetness. Finishes like a sweet, baked apple dessert. Excellent.

Bottle 375ml.
Pours golden with no head. Good lacing. Aroma is of apples, alcohol, pears. Taste is of apples, sugar, alcohol, brown sugar. Palate: Full bodied, very soft carbonation. Overall: Quite good.

Pours a clear golden with some sparse bubbles and some legs. Nose is of apple pie and brown sugar. Taste is moderately sweet and only lightly acidic. Brown sugar, apple sauce. Moderate body and soft carbonation. A bit sticky/syrupy. A nice dessert like any of the nice ice ciders, not sure if the bubbles add anything though.

pours clear bright golden with a small white cap, few bottles making their way at the top. chewy and hearty red apples, woody caramel, apple and maple butter, almost cloying sweetness though, clean yeast. moderately low carbonation, medium body, sweet woody finish. carbonation is m.i.a. at the end. solid ice cider nonetheless.

Bottle (375 ml) at tasting. Clear golden-orange with a very tiny ring of white lacing leaving some legs on the glass. Aroma is of baked apples, caramel, mild spiciness, pear, honey and apple sauce. Taste is moderately sweet, mildly acidic and apple sauce forward. Medium body. Very mild carbonation, just a few tiny big bubbles. Apple sauce finish. Pretty good palate cleanser. Tasty stuff.

Bottle shared. Crystal clear gold amber pour with disappearing white head. Aroma is rich, caramelized apple, fruity, tropical notes. Taste is super rich, sweet, caramelized apple, light toasted notes. Palate is full bodied with super light carbonation. Very nice, just completely useless carbonation as usual.

Bottle @ Mondial des Cidres de Glace 2015. The final pour of our time at the festival. So sad. Lightly carbonated darker golden pour. Slight blue cheese funk on the nose. Nicely musty as well. Candy apple, caramel, and apple pie as well. Theres a really nice acidic quality all the way through, particularly on the finish. The same funkiness of the nose is there on the tongue, too. Good crisp apple qualities as well as some sweet sugar/caramel, a touch of green grape, and just a hint of spice.

Bottle at Mondial 2015 in Montreal with Linh, Ken and Nica. Pours a deep golden body with light bubbles. Mouthfeel is semi carbonated with thick honey texture and notes of tart apples, sugar, light wine, oak, apple skins, faint maple and champagne. Great sparkling ice cider hybrid.

[6067-20131119] Bottle. Apple skins aroma. Dark yellow body with no lasting head and some legs on the sides. Sweet apple tart flavour has a long aftertaste. Light-medium body has a nice bubbly texture. Good. (7/3/7/3/16) 3.6

Corked and caged small bottle shared with GT2. Clear deep golden pour with small head, small bubbles. Smells of honeysuckle, crystallized sugar, licorice. Taste is excellent concentrated sweet apple juice, agave nectar, thicker mouthfeel. Sour finish. Like some of the best apple flavors you can ask for. So good.

> Awesome lower boost ice cider with your favorite apple pie plus acid balance
[ Bottle ][ 375mL ][ Cidrerie du Minot ][ $15+ ][ Reidel Reisling Stemware ][ 7.12.14 ]
>> Low carbonation, soft cork pop, small nucleation. Nose is apple pie with melted cheese on top. Taste is spot on juicy yellow apple, nice apple skin tannic balance, tremendous balancing salt and acid. Boss all around, though the carbonation seems to be unnecessary. 
>!< why carbonate?
Un nectar doux mais explosif de saveurs. Très sucré, mais dans un équilibre parfait. La définition même dun bon cidre de pommes, parfaitement mature et merveilleusement équilibré.

2013-11-19. Crisp dark yellow body, nice legs. Lovely appley aroma, apple sauce and whisper of skins. Flavour is pleasantly sweet, light acidity throughout, sweet fruity apple. Smooth medium bodied palate, not as complex as some but lovely. Bottle from the cidery

Bottle, shared with my wife (begrudgingly, as this ice cider business is becoming one of my new favourite things). Deep burnished brassy orange with medium sized carbonation that clings to the sides of the glass. Aroma is beautiful buttery caramel shortbread and apples, luscious! Sticky sweet toffee apple goodness, hints of spice, beautiful rounded apple flavour with nice acidity in the finish. Awesome!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: UPDATED: JUN 29, 2013 Corked 375ml. Short lived effervescent head settles quickly into a rose-hued clear amber pool. Fragrant floral red apples. Very clean, but also a tad "browned". Cedar, vanilla, rose petals, peach, honey and lemon-accents on a lush apple core. Tangy, spicy, acidic and wonderfully clean. Rich body, lusciously sweet. Strongly acidic, salivating and refreshing and new and wonderful. Spicy, peppery, jaw-droppingly poundable. The combination of carbonation and magnificently expressed apple sweetness is a new experience. I mean it almost feels like there are chile peppers in there. Its a lingering brashness in a long, sticky finish.  After a while it feels like heartburn.  But thats a wound I will suffer.

Bottle.  Pours a clear gold with small bits of a white head on the fringe.  Best smelling cider Ive smelled in a long time, smells of warm homemade applesauce, has a bit of the caramel acidity of ice cider.  Beautiful.  Medium bodied, velvety but with just the smallest hint of carbonation, sort of microcarbonation, very fine.  Sweet apples, a touch of acidity, light with lingering apple sugar.  Quite beautiful.  Delicious.
Bottle at cider tasting. Golden pour with a touch of tan head. Sweet apple, caramel, light spice, with a touch of warmth and tartness on the finish. Nice smooth texture.

Bottle shared at the Cider Tasting. Pours a pale golden hue, no haze, with some lively carbonation, no head, some legs on the swirl. Aromas are pronounced apple, touches of heat, yeast, and vanilla. A touch of honey, sweetness, and funky cheese essence. Initial is a bountiful sweetness up front, rich apple, touches of honey sweetness, mellow spice, yeast, and funk. Into the middle sweet and slightly tart apples take into account, some dustings of carbonation on the palate, light yeastiness. Finish is lingering sweetness, sustained apple, touches of honey and spice make it linger on more. Gentle, with some nice sweetness, sustained flavors. Interesting.

Sampled from the bottle. Poured a deep gold with slight orange hue and no head whatsoever but visible carbonation. Aroma was sweet apples with a bit of apricot and just a hint of acid. Flavor starts sweet with apple and apricot and a growing acidity. The carbonation distracted slightly from the cider.

2oz blind tasting of 16 different Ice Ciders. 
Aroma : Nice tropical fruits w2ith light caramel. Nice apples, not very sweet.

Taste : Nice apples, light hints of carbonation. Thin mouthfeel. 

Overall : Very thin and easy drinking. No surprise its filed under "cider" here. Interesting freshness.

Blind tasting scoring sheet : Aroma : 5/10 Balance : 7/10 Complexity : 5/10. General : 11/20. Ranking : 13/16.

Deep golden pour.  The nose is quite light and fresh.  Soft with a little bit of light fruit.  Tart apple.  Soft creamy palate with a little bit of soft apple.  Peppery and a little bit minty on the finish as well.  Soft sweetness with a nice moussey texture.  Light and very fruity.  Not as intense as the ice ciders, but there is a soft lingering fruitiness.  A touch of light lemony character.  A little bit of soft dried fruit and spice as well.

Bottle.  Pours a pale yellow with light soft carbonation.  Aroma is green apple, grass, slight white wine,  chardonnay, champagne like medium apple cider character with some slight nutty yeasty notes.  Flavor is more yeasty, green apple, must, cider, light dry mead character, more white wine, finishes off a bit tart, snappy and crisp.  Pretty good.
Bottle. Pours a pale golden body with light legging.  Honey sweet tones, apple skins and spritzy notes.  A light tart skin, and low acidity.  Very nice.

Bottled from MaxxDaddy, to celebrate our wedding. Thanks, Max and Jess (and Jesss mom for buying this). Mildly fizzy pour, not super carbonated. The aroma is straight up unfermented cider, a touch of bell pepper, not much else. Fizzy, lightly peppery, very apple flavor, that when first opened reminded me of McDonalds. Slightly oxidized, more mellow than most ice ciders. with the carbonation having little effect on the beer, while reducing the usually very thick body into something less exciting. A pretty nice cider.
Pours gold and lightly bubbly.  Smells of apples, funky, some sweet sugary hints, honey.  Tastes sweet and dry with some nice spicy hints on the finish.

UPDATED: FEB 25, 2009 Acheté à la SAQ en format de 375ml millésimé 2007 et dégusté dans un verre de cidre mystique. Apparence dune teinte jaune ambré plutôt intense avec des bulles fines et persistantes. Le tout est également agrémenté par de subtils effluves de melon miel et de compote de pomme verte et une vive acidité. En rétro olfaction, il saffirme par des saveurs de fruits confits. Révélant une texture grasse, il est assez persistant en finale dévoilant aussi un peu de gingembre et évidemment de la pomme. Leffervescence en bouche est dune agréable sensation et me procure un sentiment de plénitude. Un produit dexception et de finesse....

Stylish miniature champagne bottle, this product is a assembly of their ice cider and the crémant de pomme, making this the only naturally effervescent ice cider in Québec, and probably anywhere. Ive sampled it a few times at the ciderhouse, this bottle I had in the cellar for about a year.

Olive oil golden with mighty fine legs, the fine, microscopic bubbles rised from the bottom of the glass to form a small ring around the glass. Just lovely.

Caramel apples dipped in maple syrup, after a while a bit of alcohol was present, giving away some vanilla and passion fruit effluves.

Natural carbonation makes all the difference in the world. It pushes the apple flavors to new heights while restraining the cloyness, and as you swallow the acidity kicks in and helps out to cut the sweetness even more. Its a little less rich than most ice ciders, which is normal since its blended with crémant, but it certainly doesnt lack any aftertaste. The sweet and tart apple flavors ebb and flow, going from one side of the taste spectrum to the other with every sip. The sharpness eventually wins, drying out your palate, like after a bite from a really peely, bitter apple.

Du Minot are the kings of carbonated ciders in Québec, this top of the line product proves it once again.

The pour reveals a clear, sparkling golden color with high legs. Baked apple aromas burst out of the glass with mild spices and tartness. The flavor has the usual Du Minot class and quality, again baked apples dominate and some spicy, tart elements are there, theres a nice round feel to it and it seems to balance liquorous and sharp, dryer textures. Although this is a sparkling cider it doesnt feel spritzy in the mouth. Again I have to point out that Du Minot offer quality products day in day out, from low alcohol crémants to high alcohol ice ciders, this is a fine example of their work.

A fine offering here, a paler golden juice with the casual bubble. Rather light ultimately, but it is so drinkable. Were it not 20$, this would be a staple, I never thought Id say that about an ice cider, but this could be a daily drinker. Quite an achievement. A bit like their Domaine du Minot, this is a rather focused offering, not necessarily very complex, but extracting the flavours of the apple and throwing them on our tongues with a chirurgical precision. Limited sparkling effect just adds a tingle on the tongue while the freshness invades our spirit. Fresh is a key word here, almost crisp ice cider.
Bu sur place, version pétillant. Couleur jaune fonce. Arome plus sec que Du Minot de Glace. Elle est plus légé au goût aussi. Très bon.
